answers.answer: Well, I guess it could be possible.  Diabetes has neuro-vascular effects.  People loose finger and toes to it on a pretty regular basis.  If (and not - that is an IF) the vascular compromise to the thoracic cord, that could lead to paralysis.  There are a few documented cases of assault on the thoracic vertebral artery that have resulted thoracic myelopathy.Bob

question: Is it possible that my diabeties caused thoracic myelopathy and being paralyzed?
title: Being paralyzed
